Sentence: The PROTEIN1 gene of Bacillus subtilis, encoding a catabolic glutamate dehydrogenase, is transcribed by PROTEIN2 containing RNA polymerase and requires for its expression PROTEIN a member of the NtrC/NifA family of proteins that bind to enhancer-like elements, called upstream activating sequences (UAS).
The results indicate that PROTEIN1 is sufficient to repress the transcription of the PROTEIN and PROTEIN promoters and also to activate the transcription of the PROTEIN2 promoter.

The PROTEIN1 regulon includes a penicillin binding protein ( PROTEIN and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase ( PROTEIN , homologues of signal peptide peptidase ( PROTEIN , flotillin ( PROTEIN , ABC transporters ( PROTEIN , non-haem bromoperoxidase ( PROTEIN , epoxide hydrolase ( PROTEIN2 and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
The PROTEIN1 phosphatase indirectly activates PROTEIN by dephosphorylating a protein ( PROTEIN2 in the pathway that controls the activity of the transcription factor.
This indicates that the PROTEIN gene product, being a member of both the PROTEIN and PROTEIN1 regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the PROTEIN2 regulon.
The PROTEIN1 promoter, like the PROTEIN promoter, is believed to be recognized by PROTEIN RNA polymerase, suggesting that PROTEIN2 may inhibit PROTEIN activity late in sporulation.
Transcription of the PROTEIN PROTEIN1 and PROTEIN2 genes by final PROTEIN RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called PROTEIN

PROTEIN1 is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, PROTEIN2 an anti-anti-sigma factor, PROTEIN and a membrane-bound phosphatase, PROTEIN which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of PROTEIN back to the active form.

The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; PROTEIN present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor PROTEIN PROTEIN which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, PROTEIN and PROTEIN1 of Bacillus subtilis; PROTEIN of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor PROTEIN and PROTEIN a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor PROTEIN2
